name: Vegan Cauliflower Tempura Bites
description: These vegan cauliflower tempura bites (cauliflower tortitas) in a tomato-chipotle sauce are one of my favorite lent side dishes. Traditionally the tortitas are dropped in an egg batter and fried, but for this version of the batter, I've essentially made an eggless tempura batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Place all the ingredients for the sauce in the blender and process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring sauce to a simmer in a sauce pot set to medium heat. Simmer for 5-7 minutes, season with salt and pepper. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Sift the flour and cornstarch into a large bowl. Add the salt and soda water. Whisk until combined. The batter should have the consistency of a thick pancake batter. Add more water as necessary.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven to 350°F.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the oil is hot, use your hands to drop the cauliflower in the batter and then into the oil. Fry for 2-3 min. on each side or until the batter is crispy and slightly golden.
